original: Alde, Gustaf Alfred, arkitekt, Göteborg, f. 22/6/93 i Sthlm. G. 23 m. Alice Claeson. Barn: EHsabeth f. 23, g. 46 m. civ:ing. Stefan Wickman, Gbg, Louise 27, stud. — Utex. fr. h. konst-ind. sk. 13, stud. i ett flert. länd. i Europa und. olika period. Konsult, arkit. huv:sakl. inom inredn :bransch-en m. spec. fartygsinredn. sed. 28. Uppdr. bl. a. f. A-B Sv. Amerika Li-nien. Rederi A-B Nordstjernan samt Broströmkoncernen, A-B Götaverken, Kockums Mek. Verkst. A-B m. fl. varv, även uti. Inrett bl. a. m/s Stockholm (byggd i Ital.), m/y Stella Polaris m. fl. fartyg, dessutom restaurang Valand i Gbg samt ett flert. affärshus i Gbg m. fl. ;städer, Eriksbergs Mek. Verkst. A-B nya kont :byggn. i Gbg, Thordéns Red. i Uddevalla, nya lab. f. Avesta Jernverks A-B i Avesta m. m.
translated: Alde, Gustaf Alfred, architect, Gothenburg, b. June 22, 1893 in Stockholm. Married in 1923 to Alice Claeson. Children: Elizabeth b. 1923, married in 1946 to civil engineer Stefan Wickman, Gothenburg; Louise b. 1927, student. Graduated from the School of Arts and Crafts in 1913, studied in several countries in Europe during different periods. Consultant, primarily in interior design with a specialization in ship interiors since 1928. Worked for companies such as the Swedish America Line, Nordstjernan Shipping Company, Broströmkoncernen, Götaverken Shipyard, Kockums Mek. Verkst. A-B, and others. Designed interiors for, among others, the m/s Stockholm (built in Italy), m/y Stella Polaris and other ships, as well as the Valand restaurant in Gothenburg and several commercial buildings in Gothenburg and other cities, Eriksbergs Mek. Verkst. A-B's new office building in Gothenburg, Thordéns Publishing House in Uddevalla, and the new laboratory for Avesta Jernverks A-B in Avesta.

structured.name: Gustaf Alfred Alde
structured.description: Gustaf Alfred Alde was a Swedish architect born on June 22, 1893 in Stockholm. He graduated from the School of Arts and Crafts in 1913 and studied in several countries in Europe during different periods. He specialized in ship interiors and interior design and worked as a consultant for various companies including the Swedish America Line, Nordstjernan Shipping Company, Broströmkoncernen, Götaverken Shipyard, and Kockums Mek. Verkst. A-B. He designed interiors for several ships including the m/s Stockholm (built in Italy) and the m/y Stella Polaris. He also designed commercial buildings and the Valand restaurant in Gothenburg and Eriksbergs Mek. Verkst. A-B's new office building in Gothenburg, Thordéns Publishing House in Uddevalla, and the new laboratory for Avesta Jernverks A-B in Avesta. Gustaf Alfred Alde was married to Alice Claeson in 1923 and had two children: Elizabeth and Louise.
